author: Staff Reporter
text:
To protect poultry birds from Ranikhet disease, the Department of Animal Husbandry, Vellore is conducting a two-week intensive vaccination campaign from February 9 to 22.

A total of 1.65 lakh birds will be vaccinated during this campaign in the district.

“Ranikhet disease is caused by a virus in poultry birds (chicken) during summer. It will cause diarrhoea in the birds, leading to high death rates among the birds. As a precautionary measure, we have been vaccinating the birds against the disease every year during a two week long intensive campaign,” said K. Rajasekaran, joint director of Department of Animal Husbandry, Vellore.

During the intensive vaccination campaign, officers and veterinary doctors of the Animal Husbandry department will visit villages to administer the vaccination. “The vaccination will also be available at the department’s dispensaries in all panchayats every Saturday,” he added.

Officials have requested farmers rearing poultry birds to utilise this opportunity and approach the camps held at the nearest veterinary dispensaries to get the birds vaccinated to prevent the viral disease.
title: Poultry birds to be vaccinated against Ranikhet disease
